key_title: Key to subspecies of Atriplex stipitata

Key to the families of Dicotyledons

Key to the species of Atriplex

leads.lead_text: Leaves ovate to obovate, mostly wider than 5 mm and up to 14 mm wide, length-width ratio 1.5–2.5(–3); plants mostly dioecious, male infloresences usually branched (often copiously), with flower-clusters crowded toward branch-tips;  generally a rather coarse-stemmed, spreading shrub of mallee areas but also near Bacchus Marsh

Leaves mostly oblong or narrow-elliptic, mostly to c. 5 (rarely to 10) mm wide, length-width ratio (2–)3.5–4.5(–5.5); female flowers mixed with males in clusters along the simple to sparingly-branched inflorescence; generally a rather sparse, fine-stemmed, upright, twiggy shrub, restricted to the far north-west of the State.
